Authors:
Mariangela Girlanda, Barbara Baldan, Niccolò Forin, Alfredo
Vizzini, Sebastiano Nigris, Enrico Ercole, Samuele Voyron
Title:
Illuminating type collections of “nectrioaceous” fungi in
Saccardo’s fungarium.
Keywords:
Ascomycota, Sordariomycetes, Hypocreales, Illumina,
ancient DNA, ribosomal sequences
Abstract:
In this study, Nectria types and the Nectria-like type of
Nectriella rufofusca of Pier Andrea Saccardos fungarium were
investigated with both a morphological and a molecular approach based on
a MiSeq technology. ITS1 and ITS2 sequences were successfully obtained
from 19 Nectria sensu Saccardo types, representing 17 different species,
and from Nectriella rufofusca type specimen; while for Nectria ambigua,
N. radians and N. tjibodensis only the ITS1 was recovered. Our analyses
suggest that there is a need to introduce new nomenclatural combinations
for six species and new synonymies for seven species. For the remaining
eight species the current systematic position was confirmed. This is the
first time that these over one century specimens are involved in a
molecular study providing new important DNA sequences from precious
fungal type material.
